intro: Latrobea tenella var. platycarpa, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of bright red or orange flowers. The species is part of the Proteaceae family, which includes many ornamental and ecologically important plants. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and sandy environments. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract native pollinators.
